BR_text.BRsummary: Reference to non-existent parameter name in documentation of StereoSGBM::create
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
 
 
 OpenCV => 3.3
 Operating System / Platform => -
 Compiler => -
 
 <denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
 
 The documentation for <denchmark-link:http://docs.opencv.org/3.3.0/d2/d85/classcv_1_1StereoSGBM.html#adb7a50ef5f200ad9559e9b0e976cfa59>StereoSGBM::create</denchmark-link>
  mentions  which is not a parameter of the constructor:
 
 See stereo_match.cpp sample where some reasonably good P1 and P2 values are shown (like 8*number_of_image_channels*SADWindowSize*SADWindowSize and 32*number_of_image_channels*SADWindowSize*SADWindowSize , respectively).
 
 I suppose that is due to the fact that the parameter  was called  in OpenCV 2.4.0 (cf. <denchmark-link:http://docs.opencv.org/2.4.0/modules/calib3d/doc/camera_calibration_and_3d_reconstruction.html#stereosgbm-stereosgbm>http://docs.opencv.org/2.4.0/modules/calib3d/doc/camera_calibration_and_3d_reconstruction.html#stereosgbm-stereosgbm</denchmark-link>
 ). Maybe the documentation in the current version should be updated to avoid confusion. This seems to have been introduced with OpenCV 3.0.
 <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 Replace SADWindowSize with blocksize in the documentation of StereoSGBM::create.

comments_0.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/dustsigns>@dustsigns</denchmark-link>
  Not too familiar with this area, but just taking a quick look, does 's SADWindowSize deserve to be renamed to blockSize if it's related to ?

comments_1.comment_text: It seems so, but maybe someone more experienced with the use of this function should be the judge of that.

comments_2.comment_text:
replacing SADWindowSize with blocksize or replacing blocksize with SADWindowSize
 maybe <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=SADWindowSize&type=>looking places where SADWindowSize used</denchmark-link>
  will help to understand better.
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/alalek>@alalek</denchmark-link>
  what it your suggestion to fix this?

comments_3.comment_text:
Lets do this:
 
 replacing SADWindowSize with blocksize blockSize
 
 in public headers only:
 
 modules/calib3d/include
